text: Hi everybody, what plot type would I use to generate the image attached? Tried `bar`, but all bars start at the axis. Looking into `boxplot` now, but wondering if there is a more straightforward way. It's also necessary to create separate bars for any category (e.g., m1 in the plot). Thanks!

elements.text: Hi everybody, what plot type would I use to generate the image attached? Tried
, but all bars start at the axis. Looking into
now, but wondering if there is a more straightforward way. It's also necessary to create separate bars for any category (e.g., m1 in the plot). Thanks!

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/56477| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!

Not perfect, but you could do something like this
```using Plots
red = [1, 3]
green = [0.5, 1.5]
blue = [1, 2, missing, 2.5, 3]
plot(legend = false, grid = false)
plot!(red, fill(3, length(red)), c = :red, linewidth = 20)
plot!(green, fill(2, length(green)), c = :green, linewidth = 20)
plot!([1, 2, missing, 2.5, 3], fill(1, length(blue)), c = :blue, linewidth = 20)
yticks!(1:3, ["m1", "m2", "m3"])
xticks!(1:3, ["f1", "f2", "f3"])```

elements.text: Not perfect, but you could do something like this

using Plots
red = [1, 3]
green = [0.5, 1.5]
blue = [1, 2, missing, 2.5, 3]
plot(legend = false, grid = false)
plot!(red, fill(3, length(red)), c = :red, linewidth = 20)
plot!(green, fill(2, length(green)), c = :green, linewidth = 20)
plot!([1, 2, missing, 2.5, 3], fill(1, length(blue)), c = :blue, linewidth = 20)
yticks!(1:3, ["m1", "m2", "m3"])
xticks!(1:3, ["f1", "f2", "f3"])
